column1: 1 ^ Laudāte Dominum dē caelīs; laudāte eum in excelsīs. ^ Praise ye the Lord from the heavens; praise ye him in the high places.

column3: omnēs virtūtēs ejus. ^ Praise ye him all his angels; praise ye him all his hosts.
omnēs stellae et lūmen. ^ Praise ye him
column4: O sun and moon; praise him

column3: et aqua quae super caelōs sunt. ^ Praise him
column5: and thou water that art above the heavens.

column1: 5 ^ Laudent nōmen Dominī; quia ipse dīxit
column3: et creāta sunt. ^ Let them praise the name of the Lord; for he spoke
column4: and they were made; he commanded

column2: et in saeculum saeculī; praeceptum posuit
column3: et nōn praeterībit. ^ He hath established them for ever
column4: and for ages of ages; he hath made a decree
column5: and it shall not pass away.

column3: ^ Praise the Lord from the earth
column4: ye dragons and all ye deeps

column3: ^ kings of the earth and all people
column4: princes and all judges of the earth

column2: quia exaltātum est nōmen ejus sōlīus; confessiō ejus super caelum et terram. ^ let them praise the name of the Lord
column3: for exalted is the name of him alone; the praise of him is above heaven and earth.

column1: 14 ^ Et exaltāvit cornū populī suī; himnus omnibus sānctīs ejus
column3: populō appropinquantī sibī. ^ And he hath exalted the horn of his people; a hymn to all his saints
column5: to a people drawing nigh unto him.
